intro: Pouzolzia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated pouzolzia, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in summer, followed by the development of small, three-lobed fruits. Pouzolzia rostrata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
